title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
xwikibot joined #xwiki at 08:19 silviar joined #xwiki at 08:28 kibahop joined #xwiki at 08:32 mflorea joined #xwiki at 08:45 tmortagne - (08:45): CalebJamesDeLisl: hi tmortagne - (08:45): there is some consecutive
in Invitation.WebHome that DWG does not likes, see http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/com.xpn.xwiki.products$xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/976/testReport/com.xpn.xwiki.it/CustomDutchWebGuidelinesValidationTest/Validating\_Dutch\_Web\_Guidelines\_validity\_for\_\_space\_Invitation\_\_page\_WebHome\_executed\_with\_credentials\_Admin\_admin/ CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:45): hi proyvind joined #xwiki at 08:46 proyvind - (08:46): hi folks CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:47): hi proyvind proyvind - (08:47): is there any easy way of migrating a xwiki mysql database to postgresql? tmortagne - (08:47): hi tmortagne - (08:48): proyvind: export your mysql wiki to as xar and then import it in the postgresql wiki CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:48): You have seen the light ;)  I would do an export to an xar file and then import it. proyvind - (08:50): tmortagne: k, sounds like something I could manage :o) tmortagne - (08:50): if your wiki is too big for the standard export (does not need to be very big unfortunately :() you might look at http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Snippets/LargeWikiExportSnippet and http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Snippets/LargeXARImportScriptSnippet proyvind - (08:50): k proyvind - (08:50): thx! :) tmortagne - (08:50): you'r welcome :) vmassol - (08:52): so today is the 3rd try to release XE 2.4M2..... vmassol - (08:53): it would be great that all of us help make the release ready vmassol - (08:53): ie fix the tests so that they pass tmortagne - (08:53): yep there are still lots of failing selenium tests florinciu joined #xwiki at 08:53 vmassol - (08:53): ie stop what you're doing for half a day to focus on making the tests pass tmortagne - (08:54): plus 1 wysiwyg test vmassol - (08:54): it's not normal we need several days to stabilize a release vmassol - (08:54): the tests should pass every day vmassol - (08:54): so we have a problem to fix vmassol - (08:55): CalebJamesDeLisl: I'm trying to fix one of your tests on my machine btw vmassol - (08:55): RegisterFromAdministrationTest CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:55): Breaks on your machine and not on hudson? vmassol - (08:55): which has several tests failing locally (they pass on hudson which seems to indicate they are flickering IMO) vmassol - (08:55): yep vmassol - (08:55): they are: vmassol - (08:55): testRegisterPasswordTooShort vmassol - (08:55): testRegisterDifferentPasswords vmassol - (08:56): testRegisterEmptyUserName vmassol - (08:56): testRegisterInvalidEmail vmassol - (08:56): the reason is: vmassol - (08:56): "java.lang.AssertionError: LiveValidation did not show a failure message but clicking on the register button did." vmassol - (08:56): so the live validation didn't show up (or was too slow or...) vmassol - (08:56): while the verif worked when pressing the submit button CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:56): Yea, I have had a lot of trouble with that. vmassol - (08:57): IMO vmassol - (08:57): s/IMO// CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:57): I can't figure out a better way to prove that liveValidation is doing something. vmassol - (08:57): yes vmassol - (08:57): so we just need to find a way to fix the test CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:58): Maybe run a javascript snippet to manually fire liveValidation, I took a look at it and found it was hooked to the submit event and I didn't see an easy way to get hold of the listener. vmassol - (08:59): a lot of tests are not very resilient to change too vmassol - (08:59): like this one: vmassol - (08:59):         return !getDriver().findElements(By.xpath("/html/body/div/div/div[3]/div/div/div/div/div/script")).isEmpty(); vmassol - (08:59): :) CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:59): You found it! ;) vmassol - (08:59): did I? CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:00): You found the horrible hack for finding if the script is there. CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:00): I suppose the correct thing to do is attach an id to the script and look for that. vmassol - (09:00): well there are several places that are not correct vmassol - (09:00): like this one too: vmassol - (09:00):             By.xpath("//a[@class='tool rename' and contains(@href, '" + getUtil().escapeURL(fromName) + "')]/img"); vmassol - (09:01): (but that's for the blog category) vmassol - (09:01): this test will fail if you rename to a category that contains the original category's name vmassol - (09:01): anyway vmassol - (09:01): my point is just that we need to be careful to make tests resilient to change vmassol - (09:01): by introducing whatever is needed in the html for ex vmassol - (09:01): so that we don't spend too much time fixing them CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:02): I've been trying to use ids in the invitation tests. vmassol - (09:02): yep id are a good way vmassol - (09:02): provided we are careful vmassol - (09:02): since they need to be unique CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:03): Another thing I have been doing lately is making the tests long and test more stuff so because invitation tests would take 1/2 hour if each thing was tested separately. vmassol - (09:03): yes it's definitely important vmassol - (09:03): that's what I was trying to say for some time vmassol - (09:03): :) vmassol - (09:03): in unit tests you want as fine-grained as possible vmassol - (09:03): in functional tests you want a scenario vmassol - (09:04): (ie run checks in series and not isolated) CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:04): hmm. did you see r29642 vmassol - (09:04): (there's the right granularity to find though) vmassol - (09:04): I saw it but didn't read it CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:05): It opens up an xml file into a directory tree so we can work on applications easier. vmassol - (09:05): I know what it's about but didn't check the code CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:05): It's ugly --> my own xml parser vmassol - (09:05): why don't you use one of the thousand tools avail? CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:06): For example there are schemas and attributes and such which I don't care what they are. I just need to be able to reproduce them. vmassol - (09:06): ok found your comment vmassol - (09:06): but I'm not sure I agree with it vmassol - (09:06): :) vmassol - (09:06): anyway vmassol - (09:07): it's your code, you choose to write it as you want vmassol - (09:07): just don't expect too much that someone else will work on it! ;) CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:08): Good point. I figure if it is useful then I can refactor. Otherwise it will go in the dead idea pile. vmassol - (09:08): yes.... tmortagne - (09:20): does anyone remember how to get the current index in a velocity #foreach ? http://velocity.apache.org/engine/devel/user-guide.html talk about $foreach.count but that does not seems to work with the version we are using vmassol - (09:20): yes there's a variable vmassol - (09:20): velocityIndex or something let me check tmortagne - (09:21): yep i know that's the name of the variable i don't know :) CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:21): $velicityCount if I recall. CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:21): s/velicity/velocity sburjan - (09:21): hello vmassol , CalebJamesDeLisl CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:22): hi vmassol - (09:22): "If you want a zero-based index of the #foreach loop, you can just use $foreach.index instead of $foreach.count." tmortagne - (09:22): CalebJamesDeLisl: yep that's it, thanks vmassol - (09:22): http://velocity.apache.org/engine/devel/user-guide.html#Loops tmortagne - (09:22): vmassol: as i said that doe snot work sburjan - (09:22): I wanted to ask you something for my understanding about the XWiki platform mailing system tmortagne - (09:22): (09:20:35 AM) : does anyone remember how to get the current index in a velocity #foreach ? http://velocity.apache.org/engine/devel/user-guide.html talk about $foreach.count but that does not seems to work with the version we are using vmassol - (09:23): http://www.mail-archive.com/[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)/msg11477.html sburjan - (09:23): my question is if that all applications that use mail sending use the same lib sburjan - (09:23): or the mailing system from CORE vmassol - (09:23): https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VELOCITY-600 sburjan - (09:24): because I'm seeing a Mail Plugin on xwiki.org, and I don;t know if all the apps use that. I am more intrested in E-mail registration, Watch Notifier and Invitation manager vmassol - (09:24): tmortagne: they've changed it vmassol - (09:24): here: http://velocity.apache.org/engine/releases/velocity-1.6.4/user-guide.html#Loops vmassol - (09:24): the doc I pointed you to is for the next release vmassol - (09:25): so we have to know it's going to be changed in the future sburjan - (09:25): because if all of them use the same plugin or functionality, I'd like to improve the documentation tmortagne - (09:25): vmassol: I guessed and the new one is a lot better btw CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:26): sburjan: I think they all use it. I just checked and the core XWiki.createUser function uses an old deprecated sender instead. vmassol - (09:26): sburjan: I don't know would need to look at teh code and we do need to have a single place int he code to send mails CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:28): After a second look, yes everything uses the plugin. The core only defaults to the deprecated code only if the plugin isn't available. mariusbutuc joined #xwiki at 09:28 sburjan - (09:29): okay. sburjan - (09:29): because I want to improve the documentation aboutthe settings of the plugin florinciu left at 09:29 (Read error: Connection reset by peer sburjan - (09:29): http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Configuration#HConfiguringtheSMTPserver sburjan - (09:29): I want to update this CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:30): That's great. I saw a comment in the plugin code telling where to find all of the options. Looking... sburjan - (09:30): yes.. that's what I want to do sburjan - (09:30): especially the javamail extra params sburjan - (09:31): I think the most important should be mentioned sburjan - (09:31): IMO sburjan - (09:31): but If you consider this unnecessary, you could tell me CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:32): Here's a list of them all: http://java.sun.com/products/javamail/javadocs/com/sun/mail/smtp/package-summary.html sburjan - (09:33): thanks CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:33): We already used mail.smtp.localhost and that's documented in the Invitation app. arkub joined #xwiki at 09:33 sburjan - (09:34): yepp sburjan - (09:34): butI'd like to document the SSL/TLS section sburjan - (09:34): because it seems our javamail supports those too sburjan - (09:34): but are undocummented CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:36): :)  I think you still have to provide the encryption engine. sburjan - (09:38): are you sure ? sburjan - (09:38): I don;t know the code, never seen it sburjan - (09:39): props.put(“mail.smtp.host”, “”); sburjan - (09:39): props.put(“mail.smtp.starttls.enable”, “true”); sburjan - (09:39): props.put(“mail.smtp.ssl.protocols”,”SSLv3 TLSv1?); sburjan - (09:39): i see this in javamail .. I searched on the internet sburjan - (09:40): what version of javamail does the mail plugin uses ? CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:40): have to check the pom file. CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:41): find ./ -name 'pom.xml' -exec grep 'javamail' {} \; -print tmortagne - (09:41): guys DWG does not likes tables without header cells, what should we do for tables like the one on http://tuska.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/?xpage=rename&step=1 ? sburjan - (09:45): vmassol,  : http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Skins/ColibriSkin . Check the Adding New Theme sburjan - (09:46): this is kinda deprecated, because we have create new there here http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Applications/ColorThemeApplication which is much morea easier CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:48): Hmm, no references to javamail. It must be determined by the version of java. tmortagne left at 09:50 (Quit: Leaving. vmassol - (09:59): sburjan: anything related to themes shouldn't be in that page vmassol - (09:59): but instead in the color theme app page sburjan - (09:59): okay sburjan - (09:59): i'll move them from there into the ColorTheme App vmassol - (09:59): thanks vmassol - (09:59): (since it'll work with any skin that supports color themes) vmassol - (10:00): bb in 2mn vmassol left at 10:00 (Quit: Leaving. vmassol joined #xwiki at 10:02 vmassol - (10:08): ™ vmassol - (10:08): oops vmassol - (10:09): (that was the auto complete for tmoragne… but he's not there :)) sburjan - (10:09): :)) sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 10:14 jvdrean joined #xwiki at 10:18 tmortagne joined #xwiki at 10:20 tmortagne - (10:22): CalebJamesDeLisl: you will get another DWG failure because of the style= I think CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:23): There are a bunch of style= in there. CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:23): The problem is that's the only way some email clients accept style information. tmortagne - (10:23): yep i seen that jvelo joined #xwiki at 10:23 tmortagne - (10:24): we should maybe filter it in tests with a comment or something CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:24): I could hack around it but then it wouldn't be a preview. CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:25): Something like CODESTYLE:OFF? tmortagne - (10:26): CalebJamesDeLisl: i mean not executing DWG test for it tmortagne - (10:26): like we do for Syntax page tmortagne - (10:26): s/DWG test/some DWG tests/ CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:27): Is it something where I can at the pom and see how it's done? tmortagne - (10:27): see http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/enterprise/trunk/distribution-test/webstandards-tests/src/test/it/com/xpn/xwiki/it/CustomDutchWebGuidelinesValidator.java tmortagne - (10:28): it's not in the pom but in a customized validator for XE tmortagne - (10:28): CalebJamesDeLisl: would be better nicer in the pom but feel free to refactor ;) CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:28): I'll take a look. Coffee time right now if I don't want to fall asleep. abusenius joined #xwiki at 10:29 sburjan - (10:30): vmassol : http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Configuration#HOpenWiki sburjan - (10:30): take a look here sburjan - (10:30): Private Wiki with token has a ToDo too vmassol - (10:33): sburjan: yes someone needs to write it... sburjan - (10:33): I will vmassol - (10:33): great sburjan - (10:33): but you'll have to check to be correct after vmassol - (10:34): ok vmassol - (10:34): sburjan: actually It hink this whole section vmassol - (10:34): could be moved to http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Access%20Rights sburjan - (10:35): okay. it will be done vmassol - (10:35): wdyt? sburjan - (10:35): yeah ... vmassol - (10:35): probably at the top of it since right now that page is pretty "boring" and hard to read arkub left at 10:35 (Quit: Leaving sburjan - (10:35): yes .. sburjan - (10:36): but .. don't know what to say vmassol - (10:36): wdym? vmassol - (10:36): you can copy the content almost as is sburjan - (10:36): because setting the wiki to pe open or closed is kinda of a configuration alternative sburjan - (10:36): \*be vmassol - (10:36): it's about setting the access rights no? sburjan - (10:36): yes, but at a global level :) sburjan - (10:36): not per page or pe user/group sburjan - (10:37): \*per vmassol - (10:37): yes sburjan - (10:37): i'm dislexic again vmassol - (10:37): there are differnet levels sburjan - (10:37): I'll move it evalica joined #xwiki at 10:37 vmassol - (10:37): sburjan: this is the admin guide vmassol - (10:37): not the user guide sburjan - (10:38): i know vmassol - (10:38): for the user guide on rights it's avail here: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/RightsManagement sburjan - (10:38): oh.. sburjan - (10:38): I see vmassol - (10:38): so this page can focus on global level access rigths vmassol - (10:38): and you can point to that other page in an info box if you want vmassol - (10:38): for those who want to see details about the other levels vmassol - (10:38): and vice-versa btw vmassol - (10:39): ie from http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/RightsManagement to that page too arkub joined #xwiki at 10:42 vmassol - (10:44): is someone working on fixing those: http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/com.xpn.xwiki.products$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/977/testReport/ ? lucaa left at 10:46 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds vmassol - (10:48): thanks silvia for the borders ;) sburjan - (10:50): vmassol, : so the OLD deprecated attachments .. are to be deleted from the documetn attachment list ? vmassol - (10:52): sburjan: anything not used in the page should be removed yes sburjan - (10:52): okay :) sburjan - (10:52): you'll get a lot of free space :P silviar - (10:53): vmassol: you're welcome :) vmassol - (10:57): tmortagne: alex' use cas fits in the validator tests IMO, wdyt? tmortagne - (10:57): sdumitriu: i still have the issue with object editor where i don't have any UI to add a new object vmassol - (10:57): s/cas/case/ abusenius - (10:58): vmassol: it uses a custom validator actually vmassol - (10:58): I have the same pb as you tmortagne vmassol - (10:59): abusenius: I think we have a generic fwk and you can add checks to it (at least that's how I would have written it ;)) vmassol - (10:59): (haven't checked the code) vmassol - (10:59): ie for each page, run all checks vmassol - (11:00): rather than for each check run all pages vmassol - (11:00): so that we have all our validation checks in one place vmassol - (11:01): (and it's slightly more efficient I think) abusenius - (11:01): well, yes, but it is very XML-specific, and JUnit3, I didn't wanted to add stuff there abusenius - (11:01): and I do first download and then run tests tmortagne - (11:01): vmassol: yes that's how it should be but i did not had time to refactor that part yet abusenius - (11:01): but there are only 2 tests I can do, for ' and for " abusenius - (11:02): I'll push it to sandbox, you can see then abusenius - (11:03): (webstandards tests could benefit from JUnit4 part of it actualy IMO) vmassol - (11:04): everything should use junit4 vmassol - (11:04): we just need help to convert abusenius - (11:04): btw., is it ok to push 32 commits from my git repository to sandbox at once? :) abusenius - (11:04): (don't like to loose history) vmassol - (11:05): sdumitriu: the object editor is broken.... tmortagne - (11:06): i reopened XWIKI-5291 vmassol - (11:06): abusenius: probably ok but maybe there are some commits you can join together with cherry picking tmortagne - (11:06): abusenius: you don whatever you want in sandbox ;) vmassol - (11:06): unless the 32 are all meaningful vmassol - (11:07): (but that sounds a lot) abusenius - (11:07): yea, I could merge some abusenius - (11:08): rebase -i is better for that btw :) vmassol - (11:08): I trust you… I have never used git abusenius - (11:09): you should try, it is awesome vmassol - (11:10): tmortagne: I think that's the reason why 16 tests are failing in selenium-tests vmassol - (11:10): (the object editor issue) lucaa joined #xwiki at 11:10 tmortagne - (11:10): vmassol: probably, at least it should break some tests for sure vmassol - (11:10): I have seen some broken for sure with the error: vmassol - (11:10): "junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: [//input[@value='Add Property']] isn't present. vmassol - (11:10): " vmassol - (11:10): all the AdministrationTest ones for sure tmortagne - (11:11): in any case the tests will be broken because the panels has been removed iven when sdumitriu fix the broken UI vmassol - (11:11): actually vmassol - (11:11): there's only one vmassol - (11:11): that may not be becuase of this vmassol - (11:11): http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/com.xpn.xwiki.products$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/977/testReport/com.xpn.xwiki.it.selenium/AllDocsTest/testTableViewActions/ vmassol - (11:11): tmortagne: ah no more panel? sdumitriu - (11:12): No more panels vmassol - (11:13): sdumitriu: make sure you fix the tests sdumitriu - (11:13): Yep vmassol - (11:19): tmortagne: would be nice to have a screenshot for http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise24M2#HNewsearchapplicationimprovements tmortagne - (11:19): vmassol: yes it's planned vmassol - (11:19): ok tmortagne - (11:20): vmassol: "JMX Administration Console" title looks like we provide a JMX administration UI in XWiki now vmassol - (11:21): we do vmassol - (11:21): :) vmassol - (11:21): by typing jconsole vmassol - (11:21): (for ex) tmortagne - (11:21): sure but it was already possible before vmassol - (11:21): but not with the same result vmassol - (11:22): and it was never advertised vmassol - (11:22): it wasn't "official" vmassol - (11:23): I think the title is ok. At least I can't find a better one that is appealing vmassol - (11:23): I really like to focus vmassol - (11:23): on the fact that we've now decided to use JMX for our monitoring/mgmt tmortagne - (11:23): it's appealing for sure :) vmassol - (11:24): (even though we don't have much to show right now.....) vmassol - (11:24): for me this is a message not only to users vmassol - (11:24): but also to devs vmassol - (11:24): to remind them this is now our strategy vmassol - (11:25): (or to make them react if they don't agree, nobody disagreed to my mail so far so I take that as consent ;)) vmassol - (11:25): (only you and someone else replied I think) vmassol - (11:26): actually I'm wrong, we're 4 to agree vmassol - (11:26): you, jv, marius and me tmortagne - (11:27): we don't have any title/heading in the all the editors and now that we don't have panels in some of then DWG tests seen that we don't have
